item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 22, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The essays of Michel de Montaigne online (59 points | 12 comments)
2. Slow deployment causes meetings (2015) (73 points | 24 comments)
3. A data table thousands of years old (2020) (165 points | 63 comments)
4. City Roads: A tool to draw all roads in a city at once (226 points | 31 comments)
5. Query Apple's FindMy network with Python (381 points | 155 comments)
6. Keeping a Changelog at Work (2020) (78 points | 29 comments)
7. Murder Mystery: GCC Builds Failing After Sbuild Refactoring (3 points | discuss)
8. Rosetta 2 creator leaves Apple to work on Lean full-time (161 points | 54 comments)
9. Dividing unsigned 8-bit numbers (127 points | 57 comments)
10. How we made our AI code review bot stop leaving nitpicky comments (128 points | 78 comments)
11. Ideas from "A Philosophy of Software Design" (116 points | 66 comments)
12. The legacy of NeXT lives on in OS X (2012) (9 points | 3 comments)
13. Enum of Arrays (85 points | 23 comments)
14. JEP 483: Ahead-of-Time Class Loading and Linking (80 points | 12 comments)
15. Show HN: Eonfall – A new third-person co-op action game built for the web (169 points | 112 comments)
16. US shoots down two of its own Navy pilots over Red Sea (14 points | 19 comments)

18. Wuppertal's suspended monorail proved its doubters wrong [video] (67 points | 29 comments)
19. Show HN: Demo of my web game about social persuasion (77 points | 32 comments)
20. Home Manager: Dotfiles Management (8 points | 1 comment)
21. New York man finds Mastodon jaw while gardening in his backyard (18 points | 5 comments)
22. Fault Report – and alternative to Result in F# (24 points | 12 comments)
23. Cqd: Colour my __dir__ please (30 points | 5 comments)
24. A curious case of O(N^2) behavior which should be O(N) (2023) (70 points | 20 comments)
25. Show HN: GitHub-assistant – Natural language questions from your GitHub data (19 points | 5 comments)
26. Introducing S2 (277 points | 142 comments)
27. Spherical Harmonics (45 points | 36 comments)
28. Talking over a wall changed my direction as a programmer (89 points | 41 comments)
29. Train a Mnist VAE with C and CUDA (25 points | 2 comments)
30. Language and Personality (31 points | 18 comments)
